content.question:
It is known that <math alttext="75" overflow="scroll"><mn>75</mn></math> percent of all households in the United States have intermittent Internet connectivity problems.
For random samples of <math alttext="450" overflow="scroll"><mn>450</mn></math> independent households in the United States, what are the mean, <math alttext="mu" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi></math>, and standard deviation, <math alttext="sigma" overflow="scroll"><mi>σ</mi></math>, of the distribution of the number of households that have intermittent Internet connectivity problems?

choices.label: <math alttext="mu equals, 450 times 0.25" overflow="scroll"> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.25</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, 450 times 0.25, times 0.75, end root" overflow="scroll"> <mi>σ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.25</mn> <mo>)</mo> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.75</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </mpadded> </msqrt> </math>

<math alttext="mu equals, 450 times 0.75" overflow="scroll"> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.75</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, 450 times 0.75, times 0.25, end root" overflow="scroll"> <mi>σ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.75</mn> <mo>)</mo> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.25</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </mpadded> </msqrt> </math>

<math alttext="mu equals, 450 times 0.25, times 0.75" overflow="scroll"> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.25</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mn>0.75</mn> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, the fraction with numerator, 0.25 times 0.75, and denominator 450, end fraction, end root" overflow="scroll"> <mi>σ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mfrac> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mn>0.25</mn> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mn>0.75</mn> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </mpadded> <mn>450</mn> </mfrac> </msqrt> </math>

<math alttext="mu equals, 450 times 0.25, times 0.75" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>450</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.75</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, 450 times 0.25, times 0.75, end root" overflow="scroll"><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mn>450</mn><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mn>0.25</mn><mo>)</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mn>0.75</mn><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded></msqrt></math>

<math alttext="mu equals 0.75" overflow="scroll"><mi>μ</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.75</mn></math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, the fraction with numerator, 0.75 times 0.25, and denominator 450, end fraction, end root" overflow="scroll"><mi>σ</mi><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mfrac><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.75</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mn>0.25</mn></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></mpadded><mn>450</mn></mfrac></msqrt></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="mu equals, 450 times 0.75" overflow="scroll"> <mi>μ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.75</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, <math alttext="sigma equals, the square root of, 450 times 0.75, times 0.25, end root" overflow="scroll"> <mi>σ</mi> <mo>=</mo> <msqrt> <mn>450</mn> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.75</mn> <mo>)</mo> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mn>0.25</mn> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </mpadded> </msqrt> </math>

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Determine parameters for probability distributions.
